text: Thanks <@U26BLKGE4>! It's kind of insane considering they're a large hosting provider that we can't get anything on IP's, right?!

I don’t think so, if you’re familiar with Kubernetes or container orchestration in general, using that method to “spin” your “servers” up and down is a cost-effective way to allow your userbase to scale according to demand while also keeping costs predictable and preventing hardware-related outages or other risk factors inherent in traditional architectures.

Now I also _think_ this conversation is separate from data storage concerns (such as EU data staying in the EU, physically), but specifically for web IP addresses, there is no “static list” even for HS to reference.
